txt.en: 'The mountain itself repels us!'
'I freed the hobbit, but he is no longer with us.'
'But we press on!'
'I cannot return him to you.'
'The wind rises!'
'Willem Whisker!'
'This storm is too much!'
'Let us give one final effort, [placeholder]!'
'To the ledge above!'
You and Spalvi have climbed high up the Redhorn Pass in search of some way of reaching Bingo, but now a new danger has revealed itself: a raiding party of Dourhands!
You hear voices on the wind once more
You and Spalvi have survived the attack of a Dourhand raiding party.
'Well, what are you waiting for? Let us get down from this frigid mountain-side before it proves the end of us!'

'The higher we climb the more difficult this gets, [placeholder]! Try to keep your eyes peeled for cave entrances!\n\n'I believed we might find a way into the mountain in order to search for Bingo, but if this keeps up we will simply need to find a cave in order to survive!'
You find no caves, but you do hear faint voices on the wind

'No caves? Oh, [placeholder], I think we may have no choice after all. This unnatural storm is too intense, and we cannot stay here to conduct a longer search! If we must enter the mountain, we will have to follow the Iron Garrison! I did not really wish to, but it seems it will be the only way!\n\n'We may have to go back down the mountain and collect our thoughts before we can collect our hobbit!'

'It looks as if we will have to fight, [placeholder]. Thóvarg is not going to stand down, and we cannot fight his warriors and the storm both!\n\n'I hope you are ready! He is no slouch with that axe of his!'
Survive the confrontation with the Dourhand raiding party
Talk to Spalvi within the snow-storm
'We have found you, traitor!'
Talk to Spalvi within the snow-storm
'Spalvi! You did not think you could escape us, did you?'
'Return it to us, and perhaps we will only kill your friend.'
'Do you think me a fool? I do not speak of the hobbit.'
'You stole Skorgrím's Star when you fled, and I will have it back!'
Climb up the Redhorn Pass with Spalvi
'This cursed mountain has slain my warriors, but it does not matter.'
'A pox upon this mountain!'
'I will kill you myself, and take Skorgrím's Star from your corpse!'
'You are no Dourhand! You will die in disgrace!'
'Aaaagh!'
Talk to Spalvi within the snow-storm
<rgb=#FF0000>Look</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>look around</rgb> for cave entrances near Spalvi in the mighty snow-storm
Talk to Spalvi within the snow-storm
You have climbed up into the mountains with Spalvi in search of cave entrances.
You and Spalvi have climbed high into the Redhorn Pass in search of some way beneath the mountain.
Defeat Thóvarg Dourhand
Spalvi has asked you to brave the snowstorm and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>look around</rgb> for cave entrances.
Spalvi is high up the Redhorn Pass, in the middle of a frightening snow-storm.
The storm rages high in the Misty Mountains.
Willem's face is inscrutable, but you think he seems quite pleased with himself.
Thóvarg is not willing to stand down, and Spalvi is itching for a fight.
The storm rages high in the Misty Mountains.
Spalvi has fallen!

'Thóvarg will trouble me no more, and I have you to thank for it, [placeholder]! Not just you, I suppose, but Willem Whisker as well!\n\n'Now let us descend this mountain! We must take the only path that remains before us. I do not want to freeze solid up here, and I feel certain it is very near to happening!'
The storm rages high in the Misty Mountains.
The storm rages high in the Misty Mountains.
Remain alert for any new threats
Instance: Dour Faces
'Do you see any cave entrances?'
'Did you hear something?'
'Just keep climbing!'
'Thóvarg!'
'The storm intensifies!'
